metadata.title: CVE-2021-2014 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: PAM Auth Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.32and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mariadb-10.0 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
